tool.name: CreateJob
tool.summary: This GP tool creates a job based on the specified arguments. It can take a feature layer with a selected feature as an input for its AOI, so it is best called either via script, model, or from ArcMap.
tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • At a minimum, the user running this tool must be a member of a group with the privilege to create new jobs. Depending on the input parameters, they may also need privileges to set the AOI or data workspace of a job.

param.name: in_string_jobType
param.dialogReference:
Specify the name of the type of job you intend to create.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the job types present in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.
param.pythonReference:
Specify the name of the type of job you intend to create.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the job types present in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.

param.name: in_string_owner
param.dialogReference:
Specify the username for the user who will own this new job.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the users present in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.
param.pythonReference:
Specify the username for the user who will own this new job.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the users present in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.

param.name: in_string_assigneeType
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter allowing you to specify whether this job is to be assigned to a user, to a group, or not assigned. The following argument specifies the user or group name (if applicable). The available values are:

  • ASSIGN_TO_GROUP - Job will be assigned to a group

  • ASSIGN_TO_USER - Job will be assigned to a specific user

  • UNASSIGNED - Job will be unassigned.

Leaving this value blank will apply the default assignment for the specified job type.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job assignment.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter allowing you to specify whether this job is to be assigned to a user, to a group, or not assigned. The following argument specifies the user or group name (if applicable). The available values are:

  • ASSIGN_TO_GROUP - Job will be assigned to a group

  • ASSIGN_TO_USER - Job will be assigned to a specific user

  • UNASSIGNED - Job will be unassigned.

Leaving this value blank will apply the default assignment for the specified job type.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job assignment.

param.name: in_string_assignee
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter used to specify the name of the user or group to whom the job is to be assigned.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the type of assignee selected and the groups or users present in the Workflow Manager database.

If the assignee type is "UNASSIGNED", this parameter is not used or required.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter used to specify the name of the user or group to whom the job is to be assigned.

The domain for this parameter is populated based on the type of assignee selected and the groups or users present in the Workflow Manager database.

If the assignee type is "UNASSIGNED", this parameter is not used or required.

param.name: in_layer_aoi
param.displayname: Area of interest (polygon layer with exactly one selected feature)
param.dialogReference:
This argument provides a way to specify the Area of Interest (AOI) for a newly-created job. If specified, the input layer must:

  • Be a polygon layer

  • Contain exactly one selected feature (...though it may contain many other unselected features)

The border of the selected polygon will be used as the job's AOI.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job AOIs. Other AOI privileges may also affect the behavior of this step.
param.pythonReference:
This argument provides a way to specify the Area of Interest (AOI) for a newly-created job. If specified, the input layer must:

  • Be a polygon layer

  • Contain exactly one selected feature (...though it may contain many other unselected features)

The border of the selected polygon will be used as the job's AOI.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job AOIs. Other AOI privileges may also affect the behavior of this step.

param.name: in_date_startDate
param.dialogReference:
This argument allows the specification of a start date/time for the newly-created job. The date must be entered in the "mm/dd/yyyy" format, with optional "hh:mm:ss". All times are based on the local time zone. If only a date is specified, the planned start date is assumed to be midnight, local time, on the specified day.

If this field is left blank, the job's start date will be set based on the default start date for the selected job type.
param.pythonReference:
This argument allows the specification of a start date/time for the newly-created job. The date must be entered in the "mm/dd/yyyy" format, with optional "hh:mm:ss". All times are based on the local time zone. If only a date is specified, the planned start date is assumed to be midnight, local time, on the specified day.

If this field is left blank, the job's start date will be set based on the default start date for the selected job type.

param.name: in_date_dueDate
param.dialogReference:
This argument allows the specification of a due date for the newly-created job. The date must be entered in the "mm/dd/yyyy" format, with optional "hh:mm:ss". All times are based on the local time zone. If only a date is specified, the planned due date is assumed to be midnight, local time, on the specified day.

If left blank, the job's end date will be set based on the default end date for the selected job type.
param.pythonReference:
This argument allows the specification of a due date for the newly-created job. The date must be entered in the "mm/dd/yyyy" format, with optional "hh:mm:ss". All times are based on the local time zone. If only a date is specified, the planned due date is assumed to be midnight, local time, on the specified day.

If left blank, the job's end date will be set based on the default end date for the selected job type.

param.name: in_string_priority
param.dialogReference:
This argument provides a way to set the priority for the newly created job. If left blank, the job type's default priority will be used.

The domain for this parameter is based on the priority values present in the Workflow Manager database.
param.pythonReference:
This argument provides a way to set the priority for the newly created job. If left blank, the job type's default priority will be used.

The domain for this parameter is based on the priority values present in the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_long_parentJobId
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter allowing you to specify the ID of the job to be set as the parent for this job (if any). If left blank, no parent job will be identified.

The domain for this parameter is based on the jobs in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter allowing you to specify the ID of the job to be set as the parent for this job (if any). If left blank, no parent job will be identified.

The domain for this parameter is based on the jobs in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.

param.name: in_string_dataWorkspace
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter that allows the data workspace of the job to be specified.

If left blank, the default data workspace for this job type will be used. If you would like to explicitly ensure that the job does not have a data workspace set, you can pass in the value "[Not set]" to this parameter.

The domain for this parameter is based on the data workspaces entered in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job workspaces.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter that allows the data workspace of the job to be specified.

If left blank, the default data workspace for this job type will be used. If you would like to explicitly ensure that the job does not have a data workspace set, you can pass in the value "[Not set]" to this parameter.

The domain for this parameter is based on the data workspaces entered in the Workflow Manager database at the time the tool is run.

The user running this step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage job workspaces.

param.name: in_string_parentVersion
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter allowing the parent version of the newly created job to be specified. If left blank, the default setting will be used for this job type.

To set this value, the user executing the step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage a job's workspace versions.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter allowing the parent version of the newly created job to be specified. If left blank, the default setting will be used for this job type.

To set this value, the user executing the step must be a member of a Workflow Manager group with the privilege to manage a job's workspace versions.

param.name: in_bool_executeNewJob
param.dialogReference:
An optional parameter indicating whether job should be executed after it is created. The parameter options are:

  • EXECUTE / true- Attempt to execute the initial step(s) in the job after the job is created;

  • NO_EXECUTE / false- Do not take any further action after creating the job.

Some things to keep in mind are:

  • A job must be assigned to the current (a.k.a., creating) user in order for that user to be able to execute the job.

  • The first job step must be executable -- for instance, not a procedural step.

  • If the job's steps are configured to "advance when complete" and "auto-advance when reached", several steps may be executed in succession.

  • If the autoexecuting step or steps display GUIs, these GUIs may be hidden behind other windows or dialog boxes.

Please refer to the Workflow Manager documentation for the full list of requirements for a user to be able to execute jobs.
param.pythonReference:
An optional parameter indicating whether job should be executed after it is created. The parameter options are:

  • EXECUTE / true- Attempt to execute the initial step(s) in the job after the job is created;

  • NO_EXECUTE / false- Do not take any further action after creating the job.

Some things to keep in mind are:

  • A job must be assigned to the current (a.k.a., creating) user in order for that user to be able to execute the job.

  • The first job step must be executable -- for instance, not a procedural step.

  • If the job's steps are configured to "advance when complete" and "auto-advance when reached", several steps may be executed in succession.

  • If the autoexecuting step or steps display GUIs, these GUIs may be hidden behind other windows or dialog boxes.

Please refer to the Workflow Manager documentation for the full list of requirements for a user to be able to execute jobs.

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This GP tool creates a job based on the specified arguments. It can take a feature layer with a selected feature as an input for its AOI, so it is best called either via script, model, or from ArcMap.
